tit.cmt: 愛宮Aimiya *Ai no Miya という読み方もあるようです。

sen.j: 愛宮（あいみや/あいのみや、生没年不詳）は、平安時代中期の女性。
sen.e: Aimiya (date of birth and death unknown) was a woman in the mid-Heian Period.
Aimiya (dates of birth and death unknown) was a woman in the mid-Heian Period.
Aimiya (year of birth and death unknown) was a woman in the mid-Heian period.
sen.cmt: datesをyearに変更しました。Periodのpを小文字に変更しました。

sen.e: Keishitsu (second wife) of the Minister of the Left, MINAMOTO no Takaakira.
Keishitsu (second wife) of the Minister of the Left, MINAMOTO no Takaakira.
Keishitsu (second wife) of the Minister of the Left, MINAMOTO no Takaakira.

sen.j: 右大臣藤原師輔の5女で、母は雅子内親王（醍醐天皇皇女）。
sen.e: She was the fifth daughter of the Ministry of the Right, FUJIWARA no Morosuke, and her mother was Imperial Princess Gashi (Imperial daughter of Emperor Daigo).
sen.cmt: 親王→Imperial Princess Masakoとも読むようです。
sen.e: She was the fifth daughter of the Minister of the Right, FUJIWARA no Morosuke, and her mother was Imperial Princess Gashi (Imperial daughter of Emperor Daigo).
She was the fifth daughter of the Minister of the Right, FUJIWARA no Morosuke, and her mother was Imperial Princess Gashi (Imperial daughter of Emperor Daigo).

sen.j: 「愛宮」というのはおそらくは幼名であると推察されるが、実名は不明。
sen.e: Aimiya' is supposed to be an infant name, and her real name was unknown

sen.cmt: andをbutに変更しました。ピリオドを打ちました。

sen.j: 藤原伊尹・藤原兼通・藤原兼家・藤原公季・藤原安子（村上天皇中宮）・源高明室（源俊賢母）らの異母姉妹。
sen.e: She was a half sister with different mothers of FUJIWARA no Koretada, FUJIWARA no Kanemichi, FUJIWARA no Kaneie, FUJIWARA no Kinsue, FUJIWARA no Anshi (Emperor Murakami's Chugu (the second consort of the Emperor)) and MINAMOTO no Takaakira's wife(MINAMOTO no Toshikata's mother), etc.
sen.cmt: 藤原安子→FUJIWARA no Yasukoとも読むようです。
sen.e: She was a half sister with different mothers of FUJIWARA no Koretada, FUJIWARA no Kanemichi, FUJIWARA no Kaneie, FUJIWARA no Kinsue, FUJIWARA no Anshi (Emperor Murakami's Chugu (the second consort of the Emperor)), MINAMOTO no Takaakira's wife(MINAMOTO no Toshikata's mother), etc.

She was a paternal half-sister of FUJIWARA no Koretada, FUJIWARA no Kanemichi, FUJIWARA no Kaneie, FUJIWARA no Kinsue, FUJIWARA no Anshi (Emperor Murakami's Chugu (the second consort of the Emperor)), MINAMOTO no Takaakira's wife (MINAMOTO no Toshikata's mother), etc.
sen.cmt: half sister with different mothersをpaternal half-sisterに変更しました。Wifeと (の間にスペースを挿入しました。

sen.j: 同母兄弟に藤原高光・藤原為光・尋禅がいた。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Takamitsu, FUJIWARA no Tamemitsu and Jinzen were half brothers with the same mother.
FUJIWARA no Takamitsu, FUJIWARA no Tamemitsu and Jinzen were half brothers with the same mother.
FUJIWARA no Takamitsu, FUJIWARA no Tamemitsu and Jinzen were maternal-half brothers.
sen.cmt: half brothers with the same motherをmaternal-half brothersに変更しました。

sen.j: 応和元年（961年）12月、仲の良かった兄高光が出家したため、大いに悲しんだ（このことは『多武峯少将物語』にも語られている）。
sen.e: In April 962 (December 961 in old lunar calendar),, when her elder brother Takamitsu, with whom she was on good term, entered the priesthood, she lamented over it very much (this anecdote is described in "Tomomine Shosho Monogatari," as well).
sen.cmt: 応和元年（961年）12月→961年12月の意味ならばDecember 961になります。
sen.e: In April 962 (December 961 in the old lunar calendar),, when her elder brother Takamitsu, with whom she was on good terms, entered the priesthood, she lamented over it very much (this anecdote is described in "Tomomine Shosho Monogatari," as well).

In January 962, when her elder brother Takamitsu, with whom she was on good terms, entered the priesthood, she lamented over it very much (this anecdote is described in "Tomomine Shosho Monogatari" as well).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。Monogatariの後の,を除去しました。962 を追加

sen.j: 叔父にあたる源高明に嫁いでいた異母姉（師輔3女）が没した後、後妻として高明に嫁ぎ、源明子（藤原道長室）・源経房を産んだ。
sen.e: After the death of her elder half sister with different mothers (the third daughter of Morosuke), who was married with her uncle, MINAMOTO no Takaakira, she married into his family as his second wife, and MINAMOTO no Akiko (FUJIWARA no Michinaga's wife) and MINAMOTO no Tsunefusa were born.
sen.cmt: 源明子MINAMOTO no Akiko *MINAMOTO no Akirakeiko, Meishiとも読むようです。
sen.e: After the death of her elder half sister with different mothers (the third daughter of Morosuke), who was married with her uncle, MINAMOTO no Takaakira, she married into his family as his second wife, and MINAMOTO no Akiko (FUJIWARA no Michinaga's wife) and MINAMOTO no Tsunefusa were born.

After the death of her older paternal half-sister (the third daughter of Morosuke), who was married with her uncle, MINAMOTO no Takaakira, she married into his family as his second wife, and MINAMOTO no Akiko (FUJIWARA no Michinaga's wife) and MINAMOTO no Tsunefusa were born.
sen.cmt: elder half sister with different mothersをolder paternal half-sisterに変更しました。

sen.j: 安和2年（969年）3月の安和の変の後、高明と離別した。
sen.e: After the Anna Incident that occurred in March 969, she separated from Takaakira.
After the Anna Incident that occurred in March 969, she separated from Takaakira.
After the Anna Incident that occurred in March 969, she separated from Takaakira.
sen.cmt: スペースを取り除きました。

sen.j: 夫と離別後も西宮殿（高明の邸宅）に居住していたが、その後、西宮殿が焼失したため桃園に移住。
sen.e: Although after the separation, she continued living in Nishinomiya-dono Palace (Takaakira's residence), but later Nishinomiya-dono Palace burned down, and she moved to live in Momozono(桃園).
sen.cmt: 桃園→正しい読み方が不明です：Momozono(桃園)
sen.e: Although after the separation she continued living in Nishinomiya-dono Palace (Takaakira's residence), Nishinomiya-dono Palace later burned down, and she moved to live in Momozono(桃園).
Although after the separation she continued living in Nishinomiya-dono Palace (Takaakira's residence), Nishinomiya-dono Palace later burned down, and she moved to live in Momozono(桃園).

sen.j: その後の消息は不明である。
sen.e: There is no record about her later life.

sen.j: 『蜻蛉日記』には、出家して桃園に隠棲する愛宮の様子が記述されている。
sen.e: In "Kagero Nikki" (The Gossamer Years), Aimiya's secluded days in Momozono (桃園) after entering the priesthood are told.
